body:
Hi All,

We are still short on registrations for the upcoming workshop, and
have room for additional presentations as well.  If you have been
thinking about coming, Minneapolis is lovely this time of year, and
we hope you can make it -- it's not too late.

To round out the talks, we've decided to hold a few tutorial
sessions.  One will be given by Zack Rogers of Architectural Energy
Corporation on his Sensor Placement + Optimization Tool (SPOT),
explaining its design and use.  I plan to give a tutorial on image-
based lighting, demonstrating HDR image capture, using mksources and
using a captured lighting environment to illuminate synthetic
objects.  I may give another tutorial on rtcontrib as well, depending
on time constraints.

-Greg
subject: [Radiance-general] Workshop update
